REST API repository Contact¶

async repository.contact.birthday_seven(db: AsyncSession)¶

The birthday_seven function returns a list of users with birthdays in the next 7 days.

Parameters:

db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session into the function

Returns:

A list of users with birthdays in the next 7 days

Doc-author:

Trelent

async repository.contact.create_contact(data: ContactSchema, user: User, db: AsyncSession)¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact for the user. — post: tags: [contacts] summary: Creates a new contact for the user. description: Creates a new contact for the user. The request body must contain all of the fields in ContactSchema, except id and created_at, which are generated by this function. If successful, returns an object containing all of those fields plus id and created_at.

Parameters:

  • data – ContactSchema: Validate the data that is passed in

  • user – User: Associate the contact with a user

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async repository.contact.delete_contact(id: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session to the function

Returns:

The deleted user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async repository.contact.get_contact(id: int, db: AsyncSession)¶
The get_contact function returns a contact object from the database.
Args:

id (int): The ID of the contact to be retrieved. db (AsyncSession): An async session for interacting with the database.

Returns:

Contact: A single Contact object matching the provided ID.

Parameters:

  • id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be returned

  • db:AsyncSession – Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async repository.contact.get_contact_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession)¶
The get_contact_by_email function returns a contact object from the database based on the email address provided.
Args:

email (str): The email address of the contact to be retrieved. db (AsyncSession): An async session for interacting with an SQLAlchemy database.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Filter the database query

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A single contact by email

Doc-author:

Trelent

async repository.contact.get_contact_by_last_name(last_name: str, db: AsyncSession)¶
The get_contact_by_last_name function returns a contact object from the database based on the last name of that contact.
Args:

last_name (str): The last name of the user to be retrieved. db (AsyncSession): An async session for interacting with an SQLAlchemy database.

Returns:

Contact: A single Contact object matching the provided first and last names, or None if no such user exists.

Parameters:

  • last_name – str: Filter the query by last name

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async repository.contact.get_contact_by_name(name: str, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_contact_by_name function returns a contact object from the database.

Parameters:

  • name – str: Filter the database for a contact with that name

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session to the function

Returns:

A single contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

async repository.contact.get_contacts(db: AsyncSession)¶
The get_contacts function returns a list of all contacts in the database.
return:

A list of dictionaries containing contact information.

Parameters:

db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async repository.contact.update_contact(data: ContactUpdateSchema, id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • data – ContactUpdateSchema: Validate the data that is passed in

  • id – int: Identify the contact to be updated

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Ensure that the contact belongs to the user making the request

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository User¶

async repository.user.confirmed_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession) → None¶

The confirmed_email function marks a user as confirmed in the database.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the user by email

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session into the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async repository.user.create_user(body: UserSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserSchema object as input and returns the newly created user.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async repository.user.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_user_by_email function returns a user object from the database based on the email address provided.

If no user is found, None is returned.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass the email of the user to be retrieved

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async repository.user.update_avatar_url(email: str, url: str | None, db: AsyncSession) → User¶

The update_avatar_url function updates the avatar url of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Find the user in the database

  • url – str | None: Specify that the url parameter can either be a string or none

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async repository.user.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: AsyncSession)¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user object from the database

  • token – str | None: Specify the type of the token parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database connection to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent
